content.text:
[@Ed Summers](@n2ax/dvrm+u76UhEv6aN0MzlH0Zw7o0MOd5QIHjouSw=.ed25519)

I'm honestly not sure. I think we can infer a feed because it's an ed25519 pubkey rather than a sha256 hash, but I'm not sure whether we'd be able to disambiguate a message or a blob since they're both sha256. Similar to my recent work on [ssb-markdown](%CAzkG+w3Gs1uNtScaEycSumsNdosa5vbyT+r3O9c4M4=.sha256), my goal is to make a drop-in replacement before trying to make any improvements. üèÖ

---

[@Tim Schumacher](@o3eDT3n9urv1cyIWDuF+wQHBFj3I8OcE3L4Tla9RR8A=.ed25519)

Yeah! I think [@SoapDog](@gaQw6z30GpfsW9k8V5ED4pHrg8zmrqku24zTSAINhRg=.ed25519) is doing the same for [Patchfox](https://github.com/soapdog/patchfox), but I'm unsure which scheme is being used. [Obligatory](https://xkcd.com/927/).
